row.fun_facts: Installed in 1975, the Vaillancourt Fountain is officially titled, "Québec Libre!". The night before the sculpture's inauguration, artist Armand Vaillancourt inscribed "Québec libre!" in red letters on the sculpture. The next day when he noticed that the note had been erased, Vaillancourt jumped on the statue to re-inscribe his message.

row.title: When a Man Loves a Woman
When We Rise
row.fun_facts: Exterior scenes include re-creating the White Night Riots on May 21, 1979 and the Gay Freedom March. Interior scenes included the wedding ceremony for Roma and Diane which had a few Board of Supervisors in the ceremony. The current Clerk for the Board of Supervisors played herself in one of the scenes filmed in the Chambers.

row.title: When We Rise
row.fun_facts: Roma Guy was one of the founders of the Women's Building
